data.title: Teaching – Andrea Longato
data.text:
Clinics

As a clinician, Andrea has taught classes at many events in America and Europe alongside some of the most respected educators in the world, including Chuck Silverman (Musician Institute – Los Angeles) and Andrea Beccaro (Yamaha Drums – Italy).

Andrea playing alongside Chuck Silverman (Musicians Institute) at a clinic organized by ILikeDrums in Biella (Italy).

From left to right: Andrea Longato, Chuck Silverman, Francesco Beccaro, Gabriele Ferro.

A snippet of a concert/masterclass held in Venice (Italy), where Andrea is accompanied by Francesco Beccaro (bass) and Andrea Beccaro (drums).

Private Lessons

Oftentimes the process of learning comes with a lot of expectations, some of which might prevent us from growing and, more importantly, enjoying.

As a private instructor, Andrea’s main vocation is to support the students on their path to knowledge, whatever that might be. In this process, developing a skillset is as important as nurturing a constructive approach to learning, where the students feel reassured and motivated to pursue their own aspirations. This is true for any age or level.

Andrea is fluent in rock, funk/r’n’b, jazz, pop, blues and americana, and has developed well-tested curricula on many topics of interest including guitar style analysis, instrument proficiency, applied harmony and improvisation, reading, music theory, harmonic analysis, session guitar work and recording.

Andrea provides personalized lesson plans that are tailored to the learner’s needs, choosing from a wealth of teaching materials, and fine-tuning them to each student’s very own preferences and taste.

Lessons can be booked in-person or online. All ages and levels welcomed.

For rates and general inquiries, please fill in the contact form.
